semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Complication from Surgical Procedure for Treatment of Neoplasm
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > l. Sequencing of neoplasm codes > 5) Complication from surgical procedure for treatment of a neoplasm

content.full_text: When an encounter is for treatment of a complication resulting from a surgical procedure performed for the treatment of the neoplasm, designate the complication as the principal/first-listed diagnosis. See the guideline regarding the coding of a current malignancy versus personal history to determine if the code for the neoplasm should also be assigned. (Evidence: pg no: 37, L40-L44)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding surgical complications from neoplasm treatment procedures (Evidence: pg no: 37, L40-L44)
key_concepts: Surgical complication as principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 37, L42-L43)
Complication from neoplasm treatment surgery (Evidence: pg no: 37, L40-L42)
Reference to current vs personal history guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 37, L43-L44)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Designate the complication as the principal/first-listed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 37, L42-L43)
detailed_rules.explanation: When treating complications from surgical procedures performed for neoplasm treatment, the complication takes sequencing priority (Evidence: pg no: 37, L40-L43)

detailed_rules.rule_text: See guideline regarding current malignancy versus personal history to determine if neoplasm code should be assigned (Evidence: pg no: 37, L43-L44)
detailed_rules.explanation: Whether to code the neoplasm depends on current treatment status and presence of active disease (Evidence: pg no: 37, L43-L44)
detailed_rules.applies_to: all surgical complications from neoplasm treatment
common_applications: Determining if cancer is still active

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify complication from neoplasm treatment surgery
Step 2: Assign complication as principal/first-listed diagnosis
Step 3: Determine if neoplasm code needed based on current vs personal history guidelines
Step 4: Add neoplasm code if appropriate

code_ranges.description: Codes for surgical complications (Evidence: pg no: 37, L40-L43)
code_ranges.requirement: Used as principal diagnosis for surgical complications from neoplasm treatment
usage_rules: Complication sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 37, L42-L43)
Neoplasm code determination per current vs history guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 37, L43-L44)

references_to.title: Current malignancy versus personal history of malignancy
references_to.explanation: Referenced to determine if neoplasm code should be assigned

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient returns with post-operative bleeding after mastectomy for breast cancer, cancer completely excised
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Post-operative bleeding following mastectomy for breast cancer, no residual cancer present
step_by_step: Step 2: Assign bleeding complication as principal diagnosis
Step 3: Determine cancer was completely excised with no ongoing treatment
Step 4: Use personal history code for breast cancer

correct_coding.primary_code: T81.0XXA (Hemorrhage and hematoma complicating a procedure)
secondary_codes: Z85.3 (Personal history of malignant neoplasm of breast)
correct_coding.sequencing: Complication first, then personal history if appropriate
correct_coding.rationale: Complication is principal diagnosis, cancer completely treated (Evidence: pg no: 37, L40-L44)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Breast cancer should not be principal when treating surgical complication
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Sequencing neoplasm first when treating surgical complications

warnings: Must reference current vs personal history guidelines to determine neoplasm coding (Evidence: pg no: 37, L43-L44)
best_practices: Always sequence surgical complication first (Evidence: pg no: 37, L42-L43)
Carefully evaluate treatment status to determine appropriate neoplasm coding (Evidence: pg no: 37, L43-L44)
common_mistakes: Sequencing neoplasm first when treating surgical complications (Evidence: pg no: 37, L42-L43)
tips: Surgical complications always take sequencing priority (Evidence: pg no: 37, L42-L43)
clinical_context: Applies to post-operative complications from cancer surgery
